description: The International Longshoremen's Association and the U.S. Maritime Alliance, representing ocean carriers and port operators, agreed to extend the contract and continue bargaining over all other issues.
title: Ports' strike ends, as dockworkers reach agreement on wages

description: Fighting between the Sudanese army and a paramilitary group have displaced some 12 million people in one of Africa's biggest countries. Our correspondent travels to Sudan and gives us a glimpse of the devastation the war has caused.
title: On the Ground in the Country with the World's Worst Displacement Crisis: Sudan

description: A jury in Memphis convicted three former officers on some charges in a federal civil rights case. The ex-cops beat him to death last year after a traffic stop, and conspired to cover up the attack.
title: Jury in Memphis convicts ex-officers on some charges in beating death of Tyre Nichols

description: As the Nobel Peace Prize committee recoqnise  the work of Sudan's Emergency Response Rooms, shortlisting them for a Nobel Peace Prize, NPR'S correspondent Emmanuel Akinwotu reports from one of war time Sudan's few remaining hospitals, on the edge of the capital Khartoum.
title: In Pictures: How one hospital is faring as Sudan's health care system is devastated by war

description: Crude oil prices have risen as Iran and Israel trade attacks, but not as much as you might expect. One reason? OPEC+ could pump a lot more oil if it wanted to.
title: Tensions are rising in the Middle East, but the rise in oil prices is muted – so far

description: Nearly 90% of likely Donald Trump voters say they are concerned about voter fraud in the general election, a new NPR/PBS News/Maris poll finds, compared with 29% of those who support Kamala Harris.
title: Driven by Republicans, most Americans are concerned about fraud in the 2024 election

description: The Western will premiere at a Polish film festival next month at a screening to honor the cinematographer. Hutchins was killed in 2021 after a loaded prop gun handled by actor Alec Baldwin went off.
title: 'Rust' movie will get world premiere 3 years after cinematographer's on-set death

description: The economy is always a top issue for voters. David Wessel, director of the Brookings Institution’s Hutchins Center, compares the presidential candidates' plans on taxes, tariffs, housing and more.
title: How do Trump and Harris' economic plans compare? An economist weighs in

description: False claims about the hurricane and the government’s response got millions of views on X. Emergency management researchers say it makes it harder for useful information to surface.
title: Politically-charged rumors and conspiracy theories about Helene flourish on X

description: The former first lady says she is a longtime supporter of abortion rights. Her memoir is coming out a year after former President Donald Trump said he was "able to kill Roe v. Wade."
title: In excerpt from new memoir, Melania Trump says women have the ‘right to choose’ abortion

description: A judge unsealed new evidence about Trump’s actions on Jan. 6. And, a jury begins deliberations in the brutal police beating case of Tyre Nichols.
title: New evidence reveals Trump's actions on Jan. 6. And, jury deliberates Tyre Nichols trial

description: On Thursday, a major birding society will discuss how how to go about changing potentially offensive bird names. There's resistance to the original plan to rename all birds named after people.
title: Birders argue over plan to change dozens of bird names

description: With the new Supreme Court term set to begin, Utah is hoping the conservative justices will continue to overturn long-established legal precedents, including the federal government's control of U.S. public land.
title: Utah hoping Supreme Court will break precedent and transfer vast tracts of federal land to states

description: In the months leading up to Perry's death, Mark Chavez said in a plea deal he conspired to distribute liquid ketamine and ketamine lozenges to Perry through transactions with another doctor.
title: Doctor charged in Matthew Perry case pleads guilty to conspiracy to dispense ketamine
